body:
## What happened

Attempting to open Android Module gives an IDE Error.

## Version information

Android Studio `3.5.3` • Flutter plugin `io.flutter 42.1.1` • Dart plugin `191.8593`

Flutter 1.12.13+hotfix.5 • channel stable • https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git
Framework • revision 27321ebbad (8 дней назад) • 2019-12-10 18:15:01 -0800
Engine • revision 2994f7e1e6
Tools • Dart 2.7.0

## Exception

null

```

comment_data.body:
Check your class path. It looks like IntelliJ is finding an outdated version of the android plugin.

Let us know if that helps.

Hi, how to deal with this question? please. 

## What happened

(please describe what you were doing when this exception occurred)

## Version information

Android Studio `3.6.1` • Flutter plugin `io.flutter 44.0.2` • Dart plugin `192.7761`

Error getting Flutter sdk information.

## Exception

null

```
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/android/tools/idea/gradle/project/ProjectImportUtil

This was (surprisingly) happening for me because I was missing flutter as an explicit dependency in my pubspec.yaml. Adding the following back to the pubspec.yaml and running `flutter pub get` solved it for me:

```yaml
dependencies:
  flutter:
    sdk: flutter
```

This is the stacktrace I get when I press "Open for Editing in Android Studio" or I right-click the `android` folder > press Flutter > press "Open Android module in Android Studio". The above solution didn't solve the issue for me.

milestone.description: Work triaged but not yet planned for a specific release.
milestone.title: Backlog

title: Attempting to open Android Module gives an IDE Error
